title: Add a few more docs ready for a release
body: Not perfect, but much nicer than before.

title: Use patch.crates-io to include Embassy crates
body: As recommended by the Embassy devs

title: Mention that the DS402 module is experimental
body: This is IMO the last blocker to a new release. I toyed with the idea of removing it or feature flagging it, but I think leaving it in with a mention that it's experimental is ok.

title: `no_std` example with `embassy`
body:
TODO

- [x] Reinstate `defmt`. I got a bit short tempered and deleted it completely...
- [x] Implement `embassy` example fully

Closes #74

title: Fix distributed clocks timing measurements
body:
This is older code in EtherCrab and hasn't been tested properly, so the propagation delays for a more complex network weren't being calculated properly.

This PR simplifies the code a bit, calculates them properly, and adds a (gnarly) unit test to check for regressions.

title: Fix PDU roundtrip test to receive loopback
body: The sent frame was being ignored by the receiving parser prior to this fix, so the test wasn't actually checking the whole round trip.

title: Fixes found from testing with more slave devices
body:
- Support SM and FMMU up to index 15 (previously 4) as per spec
- Fix initialisation for devices that don't support CoE complete access
- Ignore working counter when waiting for slave status

title: Refactor init to not use a closure any more
body:
A large refactor of the EtherCrab API to not use closures for initialisation any more. This solves a bunch of problems around closures with futures and opens up the possibility of configuring slave SDOs using external config objects.

Closes #46

title: Don't try to read RX times for non-DC slaves
body:
This is a hopeful fix for https://github.com/ethercrab-rs/ethercrab/issues/63#issuecomment-1644821206

Again, I'm unable to test on my side because all my slave devices reported DC as supported which is weird. @jubeormk1 if you wouldn't mind giving this PR a test before I merge it that would be much appreciated!

```toml
ethercrab = { git = "https://github.com/ethercrab-rs/ethercrab.git", branch = "dont-read-non-dc-slaves" }
```

title: Add support for EK1501 coupler to examples
Jitter measurements
body: Idle curiosity lead me to make a basic jitter measurement using `hdrhistogram`. I could be recording it wrong and I'd like to add a chart GUI in the future but for now it prints some results every 1s after a 10s warmup time.

title: Add `heckcheck` fuzzer and a few tests
body: Already found a couple of bugs. Nice.

title: Ignore non-DC slaves when configuring DC
body:
I could reproduce the error in #63 using the provided Wireshark captures, however for some mysterious reason every single module I plug into my EK1100 shows up as `DC: yes` so I'm unable to test this fix. 

Closes #63

title: Housekeeping
body: See individual commits for details

title: Fix unsoundness in groups/group slave API
body:
Makes a couple of things `&mut` instead of `&`. Also uses an `AtomicRefCell` for group slaves which may cause slight performance degredation in some cases, but I think that's a compromise worth making.

Closes #62.

title: Add `Display` impls to print out more slave details
body:
The slave info debug line now prints more info than just address and name:

```
Slave 0x1000 name EK1100 vendor: 0x00000002, product 0x044c2c52, rev 1179648, serial 0, DC: yes (64 bit), ports [ open open closed closed ]
```

this adds a bit more data before any other potential failures.

title: Move slaves into OP state in examples
body:
A pretty silly ommission on my part! @fpdotmonkey you just need to add the following after `init` to get your EK1100 to go into OP:

```rust
client
    .request_slave_state(ethercrab::SlaveState::Op)
    .await
    .expect("OP");
```

Sorry it took me so long to get round to such a simple fix.

Closes #61

title: Make init future `Send`-able
body: I haven't included it in this PR because it times out but I ran a MIRI pass over a replay test and it didn't throw up any errors so I _think_ this is safe?

title: Add replay tests
body: This (these) test(s) use Wireshark captures to replay packets to/from an EtherCrab program. Great for regression testing I think.

title: Fix smoltcp feature
body:
Also fixes usage of `Box` in no_std so this crate should now compile for no_std targets. Note though that it still requires `alloc` to be present.

I'm hoping to redesign the API a bit to remove the requirement on `Box<dyn ...>` which would mean no dynamic alloc is required by EtherCrab at all.

Closes #56

title: Fix slave init timeout
body:
I couldn't find anything in the specs for a root cause, but it seemed to timeout reading `0x1c00` either repeatedly, or once the slave has been in PRE-OP for a while or... something. I'm not entirely sure which is scary.

It seems to work with the changes in this PR - I can now get two EC400 servo drives to get past the timeout.

@jimy-byerley I appreciate you might've moved on from EtherCrab entirely, but if you have some time would you mind testing this PR against your setup? I'd like to ask the same of @fpdotmonkey too if you can.

E.g. in `Cargo.toml`:

```toml
ethercrab = { git = "https://github.com/ethercrab-rs/ethercrab", branch = "issue-49-investigation" }
```

Closes #49 (I hope)

title: Add `Client::init_single_group` convenience method
Housekeeping
body: See individual commits for changes.

title: Check Rust formatting in CI
Remove `GroupSlave`, replace with `SlaveRef<'_, SlavePdi<'_>>`
body: A vast array of refactorings and breaking changes, but I think the public API at least is nicer now.

title: Refactor slave grouping to be more ergonomic
body:
- The `SlaveGroupContainer` trait is not longer required to be implemented and is removed.
- The grouping closure now requires a `&dyn SlaveGroupHandle` to be returned. This is a sealed trait only implemented for `SlaveGroup`s and allows some internal refactors by erasing the const generics from `SlaveGroup`.
- Internal: `SlaveStorage` is removed. Slave devices for a group are now simply stored in a `heapless::Vec`.
- The const generic on `Client::init` now defines the max number of groups, not the max number of slave devices, and should match the number of unique groups passed in (struct fields, array/tuple items, etc)

Closes #35 - `SlaveGroupContainer` is gone now.

title: Fix macOS build
body: Also cleans up some feature flagging and adds some docs.rs metadata

title: Fix slave storage issues
body:
Closes #41 

This was a regression caused by the introduction of the internal `SlaveStorage` container - it was writing the slave device into the wrong piece of memory, meaning the retrieval of that slave's info would return a struct with all zeroes. This caused the error seen in #41 as it was sending an address of `0x0000` instead of `0x1000` (which the slave device is configured to.
